chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Roberson Sr

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

10:37 AM Defendant Michael L Roberson Sr in court, without counsel.  Attorney Tess Lewangowski in court for State of Wisconsin. DE states he wishes to waive right to attorney for today's preliminary hearing, fills out form, gives motion to dismiss. Court has colloquy with DE re: waiver of right to attorney. Court finds that DE has freely, knowingly, and voluntarily signed waiver of right to attorney and accepts it. 

State speaks to witness availability, officer is on the way. Court denies DE's motion for dismissal; takes recess. Back on the record, State calls witness officer S. F. who is duly sworn and testified. Atty. Lewangowski with direct. Witness identified DE in courtroom. DE with cross. State moves for Bindover, reserves argument. DE objects, gives argument. Court finds PC for BO to branch.

9:42 AM Defendant Michael L Roberson Sr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not yet obtained counsel, indicated desire to proceed pro se and have case scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with  MEW.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 5

9:02 AM Defendant Michael L Roberson Sr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
